summary: This is an email chain from June 2020 regarding FBI travel approval for an operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation believed to be in Massachusetts. The travel involves four FBI personnel driving to Massachusetts, possibly escorting the target back to New York.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Appears to be the approving official for FBI operational travel related to arresting a target in the Epstein investigation. Their signature block indicates they are with the Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit at FBI Headquarters.

events.title: Travel Approval for Epstein Investigation Arrest Operation
events.description: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent approves travel for an operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation. The operation involves four personnel traveling to Massachusetts, possibly to escort the target back to New York.

events.title: Planned Arrest Operation in Massachusetts
events.description: FBI personnel plan to drive to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, with an overnight stay and possible escort of the target back to New York the following day.

keyFacts: In June 2020, the FBI was actively planning an arrest operation for a target in the Epstein investigation.
The target was believed to be located in Massachusetts.
The operation involved four FBI personnel, including two supervisors, driving to Massachusetts.
The plan included possibly escorting the arrested target back to New York.
The travel was approved under a specific operational travel code: CACHTU Operational travel EAN 564339.1.
